title: Weekend Round-Up: AI Takes Center Stage As Nvidia, Microsoft, Blackrock, Intel And Apple Make Big Moves

title: Tech bros need the world to believe their hype. Here’s an idea - let’s just ignore them
description: Social media didn’t live up to its promises. So why do we think artificial intelligence will be any better?
content:
There is a “hype cycle” that maps the euphoria and hysteria generated by new technology and then the consequent plunge into the “trough of disillusionment” when it fails to deliver on its promises.
The Gartner Hype Cycle was coined in 1995, timely fo... [4815 chars]

title: Anthropic tries to keep pace with OpenAI, faces off with David Sacks
description: David Sacks, the White House AI and crypto czar, has been publicly critical of Anthropic, which is chasing OpenAI in the artificial intelligence market.

title: Insane AI videos of celebs are everywhere -should they embrace it or call their lawyer?
description: Sora 2 is the latest offering from Sam Altman’s OpenAI, the company that is at the forefront of artificial intelligence technology. Operating as a “world stimulator,” it can create super realistic looking videos from a text prompt and a still photos of someone’s face. Hollywood is worred.
content:
Michael Jackson leans over a KFC table and says, “your chicken’s looking nice, pal,” before swiping the box.

title: India's envoy to US outlines AI goals, says focus on adoption across ecosystem
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 19:  India’s Ambassador to the United States, Vinay Mohan Kwatra, has said that India’s artificial intelligence (AI) strategy is centred on promoting the development, diffusion and adoption of the technology across its entire ecosystem.   In a social media post, the envoy stated that he participated in a roundtable on the theme ‘AI Sprinters: AI Works for Governments,’ hosted by the Atlantic Council think tank, where he outlined India’s strategic priorities in AI. Speaking at the discussion, Kwatra […]

title: Artificial intelligence threatening to push young people out of entry-level jobs
description: OTTAWA — Throughout her university career, Jacqueline Silver assumed her computer science degree would guarantee her a job. Finding out she was wrong was a demoralizing experience.
content:
